column3: or one of the filthy '''tarks'''.|[[Snaga (orc of Mordor)|Snaga]]

column1: '''Tark''' is an [[Orkish]] word that was often used by the [[Orcs]] of the later [[Third Age]] to describe a [[Men|Man]] of [[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] heritage (such as the [[Gondorians]]). Considering the enmity between the Orcs and the Men of [[Gondor]]
column2: the word ''tark'' tended to be used in an insulting way.<ref>{{RK|VI1}}</ref><ref name=PE17/>
a [[Westron]] borrowing from [[Quenya]] that literally meant "[[High Man]]".<ref>{{App|F1}}</ref><ref>{{HM|RC}}
but "possibly a mere abbreviation of ''[[tarkil]]''".<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}

column1: :Whenever a keep is flipped in favor of the Servants of the Eye
column2: an orc calls out "look at the feeble târks run!"

column1: '''2011: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: War in the North]]'':'''
:Orcs and Orc Captains refer to Talion
column2: a ranger of the Black Gates as "the Tark".
Orcs and Orc Captains continue to refer to Talion as a "Tark".
